reviews.review_msg: Very interesting but not an easy course. However, if you manage to read the materials it becomes actually very interesting and useful. I took this course for my exchange at SFU and I found David a very helpful Professor who is actually interested in the student itself and not just the number!

Tough subject, dry at times but if you put the effort into the readings you can get a lot out of the class. He's always ready to help you whether on an essay or a question about the class. Good solid prof

Everyone bashing David here did poorly in his class. Lame way to judge a prof, don't u think? This guy is my all time favourite professor - show an ounce of interest and he will help your academic career move forward at a rate you can't imagine. Very great guy. Got a C- in 210, pulled my socks up and got As in the other 3 courswes I took with him.

A good character is the best feature of Laycock. Everything else - watch out. He is a hard, merciless marker. He assigns an extremely heavy amount of readings, and he expects participation and ideas. Overall, I tried hard, but barely passed the class.
one of the most dedicated profs I have ever had. his courses are challenging, but ultimately very worthwhile.
This had to have been the most boring class I have ever had at sfu. He assigned to much material to read. Someone should tell him to put together course ware packs.

His sense of humor is pleasent, his punch lines are so subtle that I am not at all surprised that only a few students pick up on them. I pray to liken him to a dentist, and his most painful.... wait a minute no dental tool can hurt ones gums as much as freeden hurt ones brain.

Definitely knows his stuff. Easy-going, lectures can be a bit dry (but then, this was a political theory class), but he explains things well and his emailed follow-along notes are a nice bonus. My opinion of him has improved since taking 210 with him a couple years ago.
This guy is very insensitive if he finds that you are not picking up on his ideas which are often obscured and lacks clarity.  A very contentious professor.
Very friendly, cute in a fatherly professor way and quite helpful if YOU ASK. Classes are very hard.
Quiet, classes have never gone the full duration, an hour of class is group work while stands outside the room, poor reviews of the chapter, does not lecture
